title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 19 October 2013 - XWiki
content:
<Denis> has quit

04:59 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki

08:34 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:12 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
10:04 <vmassol> Denis: good morning. One question: with signed scripts will a subwiki admin be allowed to sign content too?  
10:04 <vmassol> I don't recall what is the condition for someone to be allowed to sign scripts  
10:05 <vmassol> (I'm trying to answer Dmitry's answer on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XEM-208 )  
10:06 <vmassol> ok I'll answer something in comment and maybe you can verify what I wrote to correct me if Im' wrong  
10:08 <Denis> well, just look at the my general idea about it  
10:09 <Denis> I have just open XWIKI-9577  
10:09 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XEM-208?focusedCommentId=77766&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-77766  
10:09 <vmassol> I've commented  
10:10 <Denis> IMO, any one could sign anything, this does not means the signed stuff will receive any special right, this is another matter  
10:10 <Denis> signature will provide integrity, and possibily, authorship  
10:10 <vmassol> ok why not, but that's the same you'll still need to say this user has special power  
10:11 <vmassol> (for dangerous actions)  
10:11 <vmassol> (like PR actions we have now)  
10:11 <Denis> the question is, do we link author of signature to XWiki user, or link author of signature to rights  
10:12 <Denis> or both  
10:13 <vmassol> ok but in any case the use case raised by Dmitry should be taken into accoutn right?  
10:13 <vmassol> (ie the ability to have some author of a subwiki do dangerous things if he's allowed)  
10:13 <Denis> Currently, I am thinking about it to be as modular as possible, separating matters (intergrity, authorship, rights)  
10:14 <Denis> then we will need some discussion how to mix them together  
10:16 <Denis> until we have the good way to sign a block of content, being able to store a conclusion made on that signature efficiently,  I do not see the need for discussing how those conclusions are made  
10:19 <Denis> the POC of Thomas D. is nice, but is absolutely not modular and extensible the way we need it, it does not allow what Dmitry is looking for at all  
10:24 <vmassol> ok  
10:46 <Denis> I have commented a bit more, so Dmitry should get the upcoming changes  
10:47 <vmassol> ok thanks  
10:47 <Denis> hope you agree on my comments  
10:48 <vmassol> they're vague enough so one cannot disagree :)  
10:48 <vmassol> so fine with me so far!  
10:50 <Denis> more I look into it, more I see new possibilities that I do not want to close, the difficulty will be to progress efficiently and progressively  
10:50 <vmassol> yeah we shoud list all possibilites and stuff we will want to do in the future but at some point we'll need to start and focus only on a small subset and find a way to progress iteratively  
11:18 <Denis> fully agreed
